result.execSummary:
The defendant John P. Garihee Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:01 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Austin Mort. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.  VRCW.
State moves to amend to Ct.1- 3rd Degree Sexual Assault to Misd. Battery contrary to 940.19(1)
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: Ct.1- Misd. Battery>>NO CONTEST
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 90 days MCJ with huber, defendant is entitled to 90 days credit, CC & DNA surcharge to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 
Adj: 9:21 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status Conference Minutes

ADDRESS INFO for John P. Garihee Jr
Current: 1002 First Ave., Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 03-17-2015)
Prior: 1211 Merrill Ave, Wausau, WI 54401
Request For Adjournment of Jury Trial - granted
for Order to Modify Bond
signed at jail 11/26/14
to modify bond

The defendant have no contact with victim M.M.C.   Contact would include direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact may be made through the defendant's attorney.  The defendant maintain absolute sobriety, except for legally prescribed drugs.  Defendant shall initially reside with M.K. at 1211 Merrill Ave. Wausau, WI 54401.  Defendant shall update the court of any updated address should he move out of M.K.'s residence.  Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.
to Withdraw Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial-stj
Attempted service of suboena on T.J.S. 11/14/14
subpoena served on M.M.C. 11/14/14

Case called:  2:35 pm
Clerk:  Kim

Appearances:
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon
Defendant appears in custody w/Atty Austin Mort

Date and time set for Motion Hearing.  Parties do not have a stipulation on any of the motions.  COURT addresses defendant's motion regrading medical records being admitted into evidence.  Atty Mort argues.  State argues.  COURT makes ruling, and allows medical records be admitted, showing the jury limited pages, with defendant's testimony.  State to bring in their expert.   If parties do not have an agreement, matter to be taken up on first day of trial as motion in limine.  Atty Mort addresses xrays.  State argues.  COURT will address first day of trial at motion of limine.

COURT addresses defendant's motion of other acts.  Atty Mort argues.  State argues.  COURT makes findings and denies motion.

COURT addresses State's motion to admit other acts that occurred in August of 2010.  State argues.  Atty Mort argues.  COURT makes findings and denies State's motion.

COURT addresses defendant's Speedy Trial Demand.  Parties advised jury trial is #1, if any changes to advise Court or it goes forward.  

COURT addresses defendant's Motion in limine.  
Para #1:  State has no objection.  Court grants.  
Para #2:  State has no objection.
Para #3:  COURT will take up case by case at trial.
Para #4:  COURT allows court officer sit with ADA at trial.
Para #5:  State has no objection.
Para #6:  State objects and argues.  COURT will allow escort for witness/victim to witness stand, and V/W corrdinator be introduced to jury.
Para #7:  State argues.  Court grants.
Para #8:  State has no objection.  Court grants.
Para #9:  State has no objection.  Court grants.
Para #10:  Court grants.
Para #11:  State has no objection.  Court grants.

State advises Court that the complaining witness' boyfriend died, and the funeral is tomorrow.  State is unknown of her mental status, and requests the Court's office advise State of who to contact if they do not have answers in time to go forward.  COURT indicates by next week Wednesday State should have it handled.  Parties discuss defendant being released on bond if jury does not go on that date.  State will advise Court when they will be ready to go forward.  COURT sets Motion in limine to begin at 8:30 am and voir dire at 9:00 am.    
Adj. 3:57 pm
Jury Trial on December 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena mailed on 11/12/14 to D.M.J.)
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoenas mailed on 11/12/14 to R.J.B. and D.L.S.)
